name: Our Favourite Places
description:
This is edition two of Our Favourite Places - an independent guide to the best of Sheffield. Not a traditional or exhaustive guide book, Our Favourite Places is a snapshot of select, handpicked places that we love. 

52 pages of 78 unique and independent places to eat, drink and be merry, plus walks, parks, galleries and day trips... Our Favourite Places is your guide to Sheffield's best kept secrets.

Printed on lovely paper with a foil block cover, the book comes with a fold-out map making it easy to plot your way around the city.

Design and words by Eleven. Photography by Nigel Barker.

Any orders placed after 20th December will not be posted until 
2nd January.

name: Sheffield Alphabet Postcards
description:
A is for Arts Tower, B is for Bandstand...

Our Sheffield Alphabet takes you on a tour of the city from A-Z, via J is for Jarvis and T is for Trams.

These delightful A6 postcards, illustrated by Alys Mordecai at Eleven Design, are printed on 300gsm uncoated card using a palette of pleasingly retro colours. 

Each postcard has a mini Sheffield story or fact on the reverse – Richard Hawley's quiff, Sheffield's biggest hill and the birth of Bertie Bassett all feature – written by Eleven's resident wordsmith, Kathryn Hall.

Also available as an A3 print.

Any orders placed after 20th December will not be posted until 
2nd January.

name: 35 Postcards of Sheffield
description:
Our Favourite Places is a city guide with a creative heart.

Inside this pack you'll find 35 A6 postcards featuring photographs and illustrations created for Our Favourite Places over the past 12 months. Printed on 300gsm uncoated card, the postcards are nestled in a cheerful slipcase, designed to look like a giant wafer biscuit.  

Created by Eleven and a gang of creative collaborators including Shaun Bloodworth, Sarah Abbott, Nigel Barker, Gemma Thorpe and Andy Welland.

We hope you enjoy these snapshots of our lovely, hilly city. 

Any orders placed after 20th December will not be posted until 
2nd January.

name: Sheffield Alphabet Print
description:
A is for Arts Tower, B is for Bandstand...

Our Sheffield Alphabet takes you on a tour of the city from A-Z, via J is for Jarvis and T is for Trams.

This delightful A3 print, illustrated by Alys Mordecai at Eleven Design, is printed on 170gsm matt paper using a palette of pleasingly retro colours. 

The print is sold unframed and will be posted to you in a sturdy cardboard tube.

Also available as a postcard set.

Any orders placed after 20th December will not be posted until 
2nd January.

name: Individual Letter Print
description:
A is for Arts Tower, B is for Bandstand...

Individual letter prints from our Sheffield Alphabet feature their illustration and mini story or fact – Richard Hawley's quiff, Sheffield's biggest hill and the birth of Bertie Bassett all feature – written by Eleven's resident wordsmith, Kathryn Hall.

Pick your initial, or choose simply because you love the place or person featured.

These delightful A4 prints, illustrated by Alys Mordecai at Eleven Design, are printed on 170gsm matt paper using a palette of pleasingly retro colours. 

The prints are sold unframed.

Also available as a postcard set and as a A3 full alphabet print.

Any orders placed after 20th December will not be posted until 
January 2nd.

options.name: E is for Endcliffe Park Cafe
K is for Knives and Forks
Y is for Yellow Arch Studios
Z is for Zero One One Four

name: A Trio Of Tours
description:
This bundle of Sheffield walking tours includes our Typographic, Poetic and Runners' tours. Please have a look at the individual tours for info on each.

Any orders placed after 20th December will not be posted until 
2nd January.

name: A Runners' Tour Of Sheffield
description:
One of Sheffield's major selling points (and the reason why many of us would never leave), is its easy access to the beautiful countryside within, and just outside, its borders.

This Runners' Tour of Sheffield takes you on a few of our favourite running routes. Pull on your trackies and trainers and head out to some of our favourite areas of Sheffield to run around and explore. 

This A3 folded to A6 tour is printed on 90gsm chromolux paper (super shiny on one side and matt on the other). The tour is also available as a flat, unfolded print – please get in touch if you'd prefer an unfolded version.

Design by Andy Welland and words by Luke Wilson, commissioned by Our Favourite Places.

Any orders placed after 20th December will not be posted until 
2nd January.

name: A Poetic Tour Of Sheffield
description:
Poetry has found a welcoming home in Sheffield over the years. Whether they're embellishing benches, overlooking stadium cheers, sitting up at students' windows, or keeping company down the pub, works of poetry have become part of the city's furniture. 

Our Poetic Tour of Sheffield takes you to just some of the poetry that is out there on the walls and streets of the city.

This A3 folded to A6 tour is printed on 120gsm uncoated paper. The tour is also available as a flat, unfolded print – please get in touch if you'd prefer an unfolded version.

An Eleven Design project by Glenn Thornley and Ella Greyson. Words by Kathryn Hall. 

Any orders placed after 20th December will not be posted until 
2nd January.

name: A Typographic Tour Of Sheffield
description:
Sheffield has a rich history, much of which is written on the city's walls. Proud cutlery firms, jaunty market stalls, sober public housing, enticing public houses: all have used typography to help make their mark. Type helps us to see the story of the story writ large. 

Our Typographic Tour Of Sheffield will lead you to points of typographic interest across the city.

This A3 folded to A6 tour is printed on 120gsm uncoated paper. The tour is also available as a flat, unfolded print – please get in touch if you'd prefer an unfolded version.

An Eleven Design project by Paul Boardman and Glenn Thornley.

Any orders placed after 20th December will not be posted until 
2nd January.

name: A World Food Tour Of Sheffield
description: We're working on an illustrated World Food Tour Of Sheffield... it will be ready early 2014.

name: 32 Domestic Objects A2 Print
description:
In 2010 our very own Glenn Thornley curated an exhibition '32 Domestic Objects' at Barnsley Civic, featuring his collection of Dieter Rams designed Braun products. 

The collection demonstrates the singular, beautiful clarity of Rams' designs and the influence that Braun products have had on contemporary industrial design.

We produced a limited run of duotone A2 prints for the show, available to buy here. Photography of '32 Domestic Objects' is by Nigel Barker.

Any orders placed after 20th December will not be posted until 
2nd January.
